io.neba.api.tags

Class RenderTag

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.servlet.jsp.tagext.TagSupport
      • io.neba.api.tags.RenderTag
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, javax.servlet.jsp.tagext.DynamicAttributes, javax.servlet.jsp.tagext.IterationTag, javax.servlet.jsp.tagext.JspTag, javax.servlet.jsp.tagext.Tag

    public final class RenderTag
extends javax.servlet.jsp.tagext.TagSupport
implements javax.servlet.jsp.tagext.DynamicAttributes
    Renders a bean using a customizable BeanRenderer. By default, the renderer with the name Constants.DEFAULT_RENDERER_NAME is used. Bean renderers and their names are configurable in the felix configuration console.

    Examples:

       <mynamespace:render object="${m}" />
   <mynamespace:render object="${m}" viewHint="teaser"/>
   <mynamespace:render object="${m}" viewHint="teaser" renderer="subsite.mydomain.com"/>

    All of the the attributes support expressions, thus the following also works: 

       <mynamespace:render object="${m.someProperty}" viewHint="${m.viewHint}"/>

    Furthermore, this tag supports DynamicAttributes, i.e. an unlimited number of custom attributes not defined in the tag definition. These custom attributes and their corresponding values are made available as key/value pairs in the rendering context.

    Example: 

       Tag:
   <mynamespace:render object="${m}" cssClasses="teaser left first" />

   In the velocity template, the following then resolves to "teaser left first":
   ${cssClasses}

    Author:
    Olaf Otto
    See Also:
    Serialized Form
